head.title: National Briefing | West: California: Sex Offender Back In Custody

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | West: California: Sex Offender Back In Custody
hedline.hl2: California: Sex Offender Back in Custody

abstract.p: Superior Court Judge John W Kennedy of Contra Costa County, California, rules that Cary Verse, convicted sex offender who was released in 2004 and who struggled to find housing amid community protests, must be sent back to mental hospital; Verse breached his release agreement when he was recently taken into custody by police after being stopped with 14-year-old boy in his car (S)

block.p: A Superior Court judge in Contra Costa County ruled that Cary Verse, a convicted sex offender who was released in 2004 and who struggled to find housing amid community protests, had violated the terms of his release and must be returned to a mental hospital. The judge, John W. Kennedy, said Mr. Verse, 36, had committed ''serious'' violations of his release. Mr. Verse was recently taken into custody after the police stopped him for a traffic violation. He had a 14-year-old boy in his car, a breach of his release agreement.
